subject: RE: [junit] your opinion needed: package for unit testing codes
msgSnippet: ... these examples are *really* helpful. I have only been doing unit testing (for each class) for a few months. and trying to figure out how to organize the
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Charles Hayes [mailto:charles.hayes@...]
> Sent: Saturday, January 31, 2004 2:32 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] your opinion needed: package for unit testing codes
>
> Thanks for sharing this. I like this even better.
>
> Sorry if I led us down a rathole off the main JUnit subject, but I
> thought perhaps the project organization is
> a part of using JUnit successfully.
>
> Charles
>

these examples are *really* helpful. I have only been doing unit testing
(for each class) for a few months. and trying to figure out how to organize
the directory structures in cvs and ant to facilitate the different levels
of testing is still a puzzle (reading ant in anger ant java tools for xp).
So please keep the examples coming!

thanks
